title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: repository contains model solution simulatr, example package learning software development best-practices R packages.

title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: get version repository created , use green ‘Use template’ button top right section repository. copies clean version repository account.

title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: allow others make changes repository easily, invite collaborators via ‘Settings’ tab (top right). ‘Collaborators’ can add others via GitHub handles. Make sure collaborators ‘write’ access

what: Clone the repository into your workspace
title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: Rstudio, create new project select ‘Version Control’, ‘git’. Enter https://github.com/[-github-username]/[repository-name].git repository URL continue. ‘clone’ (download) repository working directory. RStudio automatically sets communication GitHub common command (pull/push/commit) available ‘Git’ tab within GitHub. collaborator someone elses project URL works !

title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: following assumes using posit.cloud run Rstudio. First install packages. Install package now need set git credentials GitHub.com. requires personal access token - ‘usethis’ package can help: opens corresponding page GitHub.com can simply copy personal access token clipboard (default options fine). call enter token register . Next, switch R ‘Console’ ‘Terminal’ tab tell git
code: install.packages("devtools") install.packages("pkgdown") install.packages("usethis") devtools::install() usethis::gh_token_help() usethis::create_github_token() gitcreds::gitcreds_set() git config --global user.email "you@example.com" git config --global user.name "Your Name"

title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: Run package checks root directory clicking ‘Check’ ‘Build’ tab RStudio inspect output find errors warnings.

title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: Divide problems collaborators. create branch ‘main’ using RStudio interface. Start working problems make small changes. Stage, commit, push changes GitHub repository. Open repository browser, GitHub automatically suggest open new pull request branch just pushed. Follow instructions open pull request. See automated checks (details can found .github/workflows) start running pull request tab GitHub. Continue edit/stage/commit/push happy work (checks need pass unless fix problems time!) pull request view, invite collaborator review code. get approval, merge pull request integrate changes. Celebrate! Hint: start file R/f_simulate_continuous_data.R Hint: editing documentation (roxygen comments) need run devtools:document() update actual *.Rd documentation!

what: Bonus: automatically build and deploy documentation
title: Generator for Reproducible Fake Data
text: advanced topic can require tinkering get working. can build pkgdown documentation locally, using automate github actions, resort ‘usethis’ package, usually fairly date recent changes github actions: Follow instructions (OK overwrite _pkgdown!). generates new workflow file .github/workflows/pkgdown.yml. Open file add top make sure workflow can write repository. forget stage/commit/push changes ‘main’ branch. minutes, documentation website available https://yourname.github.io/reponame/.
code: pkgdown::build_site() # does not look too pretty on posit.cloud usethis::use_pkgdown_github_pages() permissions:   contents: write

what: Get Simulated Two Arm Means — getSimulatedTwoArmMeans
title: Get Simulated Two Arm Means — getSimulatedTwoArmMeans
text: Simulates returns normally distributed continuous dataset two groups.

text: x SimulationResult object plot. ... used main overall title plot. xlab title x axis. ylab title y axis.

title: Plot Simulation Result — plot.SimulationResult
text: ggplot2 object.

title: Plot Simulation Result — plot.SimulationResult
text: Uses ggplot2 create plot.

title: Plot Simulation Result — plot.SimulationResult
code: x <- getSimulatedTwoArmMeans(n1 = 50, n2 = 50, mean1 = 5, mean2 = 7,                              sd1 = 3, sd2 = 4, seed = 123) if (require(ggplot2)) plot(x) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Error in plot.SimulationResult(x): not implemented yet

title: Print Simulation Result — print.SimulationResult
text: Generic function print SimulationResult object.

title: Print Simulation Result — print.SimulationResult
text: x SimulationResult object print. ... arguments passed methods.

title: Print Simulation Result — print.SimulationResult
code: x <- getSimulatedTwoArmMeans(n1 = 50, n2 = 50, mean1 = 5, mean2 = 7,                              sd1 = 3, sd2 = 4, seed = 123) print(x) #> [1] "SimulationResult"
